image.altText: A man wearing a suit and tie speaks to microphones on stands in front of glass windows

props.synopsis: The SA and ACT education ministers are calling for a national inquiry into how coloured play sand contaminated with asbestos was imported into the country, with more than 450 SA Department for Education sites now impacted.

title.children: ACT joins SA in calls for urgent national inquiry into asbestos sand

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt stands between tall warehouse shelves, some are empty

props.synopsis: Creditors of disability employer Bedford are concerned they will not see money repaid, as the company prepares for sale to secure its future.

title.children: Bedford supplier says he has not 'received a cent' of $50,000 owed

image.altText: UniSA's City West campus with the University of Adelaide medical building.

props.synopsis: The co-vice chancellors of the new Adelaide University says the mammoth task of merging two universities has its own complexities.

title.children: Nothing like Adelaide uni merger 'has been attempted in Australia before'

image.altText: an elderly lady and a man sitting at a table with two gold trophies

props.synopsis: Horse trainer Tony McEvoy returned to his hometown of Streaky Bay, on South Australia's west coast, with trophies in tow after his horse Half Yours' recent wins at the Caulfield and Melbourne cups.

title.children: Winning Melbourne Cup trainer brings trophies home to 96yo mum

image.altText: Jasmine smiles while wearing a red jacket and black wide-brimmed hat with a cream underside

props.synopsis: A girl who died, allegedly as a result of criminal neglect by her mother, had attended school with bruises and had lunches that "didn't seem" edible, a court has heard.

title.children: Alleged manslaughter victim had bruises and 'off' lunches, court told

image.altText: Parent Luke Driscoll stands holding his daughter outside of his home in Broken Hill.

props.synopsis: One of the few childcare operators in Broken Hill has closed its doors indefinitely with 24 hours warning after entering voluntary administration.

title.children: Parents in 'childcare desert' scrambling as operator goes into administration

image.altText: Aerial view of a mining site. The dirt is orange and brown.

props.synopsis: A mine in South Australia's Murray Mallee is ceasing operations and says it will rehabilitate the site back to its original condition. However, the site's owner says the land will never get back to what it was before mining.

title.children: Landholder says mine company's promise to revegetate site not possible

image.altText: steelworks site with gas pipe flame flare

props.synopsis: Shareholders and executives observe a minute's silence at BlueScope's AGM for the young worker killed at Port Kembla steelworks.

title.children: Worker's death overshadows BlueScope AGM

image.altText: Men in dark suits carry a coffin

props.synopsis: Family, politicians and the who's who of Australian broadcasting have gathered at Sydney's St Andrew's Cathedral to farewell the legendary John Laws.

title.children: John Laws remembered for kindness as hundreds attend state funeral

image.altText: Para-cyclist standing on the top step of podium, smiling, gold medal around her neck, holding flowers.

props.synopsis: Heartfelt tributes from across the Australian sporting landscape have flooded social media after the death of Paralympic and world champion para-cyclist Paige Greco.

title.children: Tributes flow after death of Paralympic champion Paige Greco

image.altText: GettyImages-1508727893

props.synopsis: ABC Sport and Australian cricketing legend Glenn McGrath part ways due to the former fast bowler's relationship with a betting company.

title.children: ABC and Test cricket legend part ways over gambling company sponsorship

image.altText: A man in a suit speaks at a lectern.

props.synopsis: In an address to the National Press Club, Hugh Marks says he inherited a "fearfulness" within the public broadcaster but that it is improving in its response to mistakes and external scrutiny.

title.children: ABC managing director tells journalists not to 'second-guess' their work

image.altText: A boat on land.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese is refusing to be drawn on how much a program to remove people from Australia's northern waters using repurposed fishing boats is costing, saying it is a legacy project.

title.children: PM says no apologies over Border Force's secret boat returnee scheme

image.altText: two men and a woman stand against a dark red backdrop. one man holds an aria award.

props.synopsis: Missy Higgins, Amyl and The Sniffers, Ninajirachi and RUFUS DU SOL are some of the acts up for big awards at this year's ARIAs. Follow live.

title.children: ARIAs kick off with Amyl and the Sniffers claiming best group

image.altText: A hand holds a wallet with cash coming out.

props.synopsis: ABS figures show workers received a real pay increase over the past year, but economists warn that is likely to flip over coming months as inflation increases and wages growth slows further.

title.children: Wage growth remains steady, just ahead of inflation

image.altText: A collage of the different plans

props.synopsis: As Donald Trump's plan for Gaza gets UN approval, the proposals for how the territory might be developed are circulating and advocates are worried about who they ultimately benefit.

title.children: How 'disaster capitalism' is looking to cash in on Gaza's misery

image.altText: A man on a car bonnet at night time makes a phone gesture with his right hand

props.synopsis: A road rage attack that saw a motorcyclist ride a P-plater's bonnet all the way to a police station has cost him his licence for eight months.

title.children: Road-raging rider loses licence over bonnet ride to police station

image.altText: A photo taken from behind of rows of students sitting at desks in black hoodies with "class of 25" written in white and red.

props.synopsis: One parent says her child's cohort at Hobart College was initially given an incorrect formula sheet for their biology exam.

title.children: Parents frustrated by more exam errors months after review

image.altText: Marg Horwell

props.synopsis: Growing up, Aussie Marg Horwell wanted to be an actor, but soon found she had an affinity for set and costume design that has taken her to Broadway.

title.children: Marg Horwell never used power tools before set design — now she's got a Tony

image.altText: A woman and a man standing inside a newsroom and smiling at the camera, with television screens in the background.

props.synopsis: Some people refer to attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder as "a superpower" while others describe their ADHD symptoms as debilitating. Can both be true?

title.children: What the experts want you to know about these key ADHD symptoms

image.altText: A man with short dark grey hair, in a suit and tie, smiling with his nose scrunched up, with a trophy in the background

props.synopsis: The prestigious Booker Prize, worth $100,000, announced its 2025 winner last week. Do you remember who won? Test your knowledge of the world's favourite book awards with our quiz.

title.children: Quiz: Do you remember who won the Booker just a week ago?

image.altText: A Singapore Airlines plane on a tarmac alongside an ExxonMobil refuelling vehicle

props.synopsis: Passenger flights from Singapore are set to become more costly after the announcement of a world-first sustainable fuel tax to be included in travellers' ticket prices.

title.children: Flying through this global hub is set to get more expensive. Here's why

image.altText: A infrared image, black background with a blue / green / red swirl appearing just along the Top End of NT coast.

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology says Tropical Cyclone Fina has formed off the NT coast. Here's what you need to know to prepare.

title.children: Here's what you need to know about Cyclone Fina off the NT coast

image.altText: A sandstone building with a sign reading 'Department of Communities Housing'.

props.synopsis: A mother who was facing eviction from her social housing home after complaints from neighbours will be allowed to stay, after a court finds the incidents mostly stemmed from her domestic violence abuse.

title.children: Housing Dept tried to evict DV victim after noise complaints related to abuse

image.altText: Couple sits on bench looking out at sea.

props.synopsis: Superannuation products that fail the federal government's performance test are still offered to those already retired at a potentially huge cost, according to the consumer advocate.

title.children: How retirees are failed by Australia's superannuation system

image.altText: A man wearing a black suit has his arms outstretched in exasperation.

props.synopsis: Socceroos coach Tony Popovic laments a "disappointing" penalty decision as the Socceroos fall to a 3-0 loss to Colombia in New York.

title.children: Popovic fumes at penalty decision in 3-0 friendly loss to Colombia in New York

image.altText: CSIRO scientist in lab

props.synopsis: The chief executive of the CSIRO has defended the decision to cut hundreds of jobs, arguing the organisation needs to alter its priorities to remain relevant.

title.children: 'The cost of science has gone up': CSIRO chief defends job cuts

image.altText: Jess Wilson wearing a white top and blue blazer standing in front of green hedges.

props.synopsis: The Liberals in two big Australian states are realigning themselves — shifting to what Sussan Ley once described as the sensible centre.

title.children: Liberals in two big states are realigning themselves to the centre

image.altText: A large fire blazing in the background as residents watch

props.synopsis: The fire broke out during strong winds on Tuesday evening near a fishing port in the city of Oita and spread to a forest.

title.children: Fire destroys 170 buildings in 'blink of an eye' in southern Japan

image.altText: An old painting of a woman hanging on a wall.

props.synopsis: A portrait by Gustav Klimt fetched a record price at a New York auction, which also sold a fully functional gold toilet, a satirical artwork by Maurizio Cattelan, for millions.

title.children: Gold toilet, Klimt portrait sell for millions at Sotheby’s

image.altText: US President Donald Trump shakes hands with the Saudi Crown Prince smiling.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump warmly welcomes the Saudi crown prince to the White House where he deflects journalists' questions about Mohammed bin Salman's role in the killing of reporter Jamal Khashoggi, saying: "Things happened, but he knew nothing about it."

title.children: 'Things happen': Trump defends Saudi prince over killing of Washington Post journalist

image.altText: A man felxes after weighing in for a boxing match

props.synopsis: After losing three of his past four fights, Tim Tszyu's next bout will be in Sydney as the 31-year old attempts to bring his career back from the brink.

title.children: Tim Tszyu returns to Sydney for next fight as he looks to save a career on the brink

image.altText: A woman with blue hair and rimless glasses in a floral brown cardigan stares off camera as a tram approaches on the road behind.

props.synopsis: Victoria's Auditor-General has found less than one in five tram services in Melbourne are accessible, with the Department of Transport and Planning failing to set any targets or direct funding to improve the tram network.

title.children: Commuters waiting half an hour longer to access low floor trams

image.altText: A man and woman sitting at a dining table looking intensely at paperwork and a calculator

props.synopsis: Switching to fortnightly repayments from monthly — if you can afford it — can help you pay down your mortgage faster. Here’s why.

title.children: Should you make mortgage repayments monthly, fortnightly or weekly?

image.altText: A boy in a black jumper with a red sash.

props.synopsis: The brother of schoolboy Terry Floyd, who disappeared 50 years ago, has accused the Victorian government of breaking its public promise to fund the search for his remains.

title.children: Victorian government breaks promise to murdered child's family
